Description: Upper body sherd of Attic red-figured pottery bell- or calyx-krater; interior painted black with reserved band near top of sherd; exterior: red-figured decoration consisting of youth wearing headdress of competitor in torch race (preserved, head wearing stephane, nude upper body, and hand, to right). Relief contour except for hair. Brown shading above eye, brown lines on shoulder and chest. Rays of head-dress yellow or reserved. Graffito inscription on inside.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Attributed by Beazley to the Painter of Vienna 1089. Close to Leiden T.2962 in style and subject matter.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (pl. 27, 17)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1166)
